question: Which year was fixed to achieve most of the Sustainable Development Goals?
explanation: On 25 September 2015, United Nations has adopted the resolution on Transforming our world: the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, which has 169 targets in 17 goals called Sustainable Development Goals. These goals are legally non-binding and have succeeded the eight MDGs, which were adopted in 2000 for fifteen years in Rio 20+ summit.
